intro: Brachysema bossiaeoides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant features velvety, waxy leaves that are typically dark green with a striking white or silver midrib. It produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white, which bloom throughout the year under proper care. Due to its ornamental value, it is widely cultivated as a houseplant.
